sub_topic: Show that every group of order 20 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C20, the dihedral group D10, or the non-abelian group of order 20.
message_1: How many distinct isomorphisms are there between the non-abelian group of order 20 and the cyclic group C20?
message_2:
There are no distinct isomorphisms between a non-abelian group of order 20 and the cyclic group C20. 

The reason is that isomorphisms preserve the group structure, and the structure of a non-abelian group is fundamentally different from that of an abelian group. Since the cyclic group C20 is abelian (all cyclic groups are abelian), there cannot be any isomorphisms between a non-abelian group of order 20 and C20.
